I have no idee why that suddenly happens with RC2 and an integration build 
after that. I didn't install any extra plugins. And the problem is that the 
stacktrace is showing Eclipse only code.

Christophe please investigate.  If this is easily reproducible, we should 
consider it for RC3.

Johan,
Does Eclipse still work normally?
You must be bringing up a popup menu somewhere isnt'it? Can you report in 
which view?

Thanks
Chris

i don't have to bring up a popup. Just select something different (a editor a 
view of a menu) then the dialog popups up. And what i select doesn't get 
selected and after that i select it again it works.

I do get a bit of a feeling that it does happen because i use 2 views (Fast 
view and a normal view) of JFaceDbc plugin. But that plugin did work fine 
before RC2. And i am not sure yet that it does happen because i start use that 
plugin (you could try it out it is on sourceforge)

Hi Johan,

This problem has some similarity with bug 22456.

An odd question. Does it still happen after you reboot your machine?
When you say the problem happen after RC2, are you referring to the RC2 of 
Eclipse or of your plugin?

I tried the plugin (which looks nice btw...). But I could not reproduce this 
problem.
I also tried creating popup menus with 30000 separators without problem, I 
don't know why the OS failed in your case.

Chris
